data.title: Spain (1829). Allegory of the wedding between Ferdinand VII
data.meta_description: Prints of Spain (1829). Allegory of the wedding between Ferdinand VII of Spain and Maria Christina of the Two Sicilies
data.text:
Mary Evans Picture Library Photo Prints and Wall Art

Spain (1829). Allegory of the wedding between

Spain (1829). Allegory of the wedding between Ferdinand VII of Spain and Maria Christina of the Two Sicilies. Litography. SPAIN. Madrid. Museo de Historia. Mary Evans Picture Library makes available wonderful images created for people to enjoy over the centuries. Â© Mary Evans/M.C.Esteban/Iberfoto

Media ID 8284741

Allegory Christina Elder Historia Litography Maria Museo Older Sicilies Persons

Framed Prints

Introducing the latest addition to our Framed Prints collection at Media Storehouse: "Spain (1829). Allegory of the wedding between Ferdinand VII of Spain and Maria Christina of the Two Sicilies," an exquisite work of art from Mary Evans Prints Online. This stunning litography piece captures the grandeur and elegance of the royal wedding, which took place in Madrid at the Museo de Historia. Transport yourself back in time with this beautiful and intricate depiction of Spain's rich history. Our high-quality framed prints are not only a feast for the eyes but also a conversation starter in any home or office. Order yours today and add a touch of history and sophistication to your space.

Photo Prints

Discover the captivating beauty of history with our exquisite selection of photographic prints from Media Storehouse. This rare and enchanting image, titled "Spain (1829). Allegory of the wedding between Ferdinand VII of Spain and Maria Christina of the Two Sicilies," is an extraordinary piece from the rich archives of Mary Evans Prints Online. Originally a litography, this captivating artwork depicts the grand wedding ceremony between Ferdinand VII of Spain and Maria Christina of the Two Sicilies, an event that marked a significant moment in Spanish history. Housed in the esteemed Museo de Historia in Madrid, this image offers a unique glimpse into the opulence and grandeur of the past. Bring the allure of Spain's regal past into your home or office with this stunning photographic print. Each print is carefully crafted using the finest materials to ensure the highest possible quality and vibrant color representation. Add this captivating piece to your collection and embellish your space with a touch of history and elegance.

Poster Prints

Introducing the stunning "Spain (1829). Allegory of the Wedding between Ferdinand VII of Spain and Maria Christina of the Two Sicilies" poster print from our Media Storehouse collection. This exquisite piece, sourced from the esteemed Mary Evans Prints Online, is an 1829 litography depicting the historic union between Ferdinand VII and Maria Christina. A captivating blend of history and art, this poster is a must-have for any space seeking a touch of European elegance and tradition. Bring the rich heritage of Spain into your home or office with this beautifully preserved print from the Museo de Historia in Madrid. Experience the timeless allure of this allegorical masterpiece, now available as a poster print from Media Storehouse.

Jigsaw Puzzles

Introducing the captivating "Spain (1829). Allegory of the Wedding Between Ferdinand VII of Spain and Maria Christina of the Two Sicilies" jigsaw puzzle from Media Storehouse. This intriguing puzzle features an exquisite image from Mary Evans Prints Online, showcasing the historical litography art piece housed in Madrid's Museo de Historia. Engage in a delightful puzzle-solving adventure as you bring to life this stunning allegory depicting the significant union between two royal figures in Spanish history. Immerse yourself in the rich details and vibrant colors, making this jigsaw puzzle an enchanting addition to your collection.
